places_with_reviews.name: Ardhagiri Anjaneya Swamy Temple/Aragonda Anjaneyaswamy
places_with_reviews.address: Ghat Rd, 7XV2+RFX, Aragonda, Thavanampalli, Chittoor, Paimagham, Andhra Pradesh 517129, India

reviews.text: Blessed to Visit this temple. Peaceful location with Norma crowd. Good facilitates and road to reach the temple. A must visit temple for lord Hanuman blessings.

Very Pleasant  place. Everyone will get the peaceful Darshanam of Lord Hanuman here.

You'll get pure water from gundam here

Beautiful environment 💗

Good place to visit good view and nice seenarys

Vehicles need to pay 20per vehicle for going to top of hill

The way to ayyappa temple was not good till shiva temple it's good
Very peaceful temple on hill side and has holy water, which is believed to have natural medicine properties

First time hearing about this place. This place is called ardhagiri as a piece of Sanjeevani mountain fell at this place when lord Hanuman was carrying it. Serene place, gets very busy on pournami days. There's an entry toll of 50 rupees. Lots of parking available.

places_with_reviews.name: Abhaya Anjaneya Swamy Temple

reviews.text: Jus loved it.  .. every poornima and Tuesday there are special poojaa and abhishekam s.. and free meal distribution at evenings.. good place for spiritual and relaxation..
Today I've visited this temple, It's very dainty, Pass and visit the place as many times as you can.

Don't miss this temple if you pass through this road.  Just look around this temple !! Fully surrounded by mountains and you have coconut farm in front of the temple . Serine atmosphere . In the temple they gave yummy curd rice and tamarind rice . Anjaneya is big in stature. He must be 20 feet tall . Nice and peaceful!!

It is a new temple on the way to Tirupathi, located in a small village. It is a very small temple, hence not much of crowd. The idol of Lord Anjaneya is magnificent in size, though much smaller than Nanganallur or Namakkal Anjaneya temple, yet pleasing to devotees.
On the way to Tirumala on foot, we were here on  6th day ....

places_with_reviews.name: Diguvamagham Ramalayam

reviews.text:
It is my native village. In the past, during my childhood, I saw and practised many of the oldest community activities like 1)  mari-bhiksham by the villagers especially by the children, chata-poraka by Sri Balakrishna Naidu, and,gorrelu-mekalu _ a large gathering of village children by late Sri Kuntamukkala Lakshmaiah Naidu and late Sri late Dasari Muneppa for a procession to cheruvu on the ganga-jathara festival day, 2) the nine days Sri Rama Navami utsavalu, 3) a month long Bhajanalu during Dhanurmasam, 4) Yeddulu tharime Pandava on Makara Sankranthi day, 5) the  greatest Maha Bharatha Harikathalu with Rathrivela Natakalu in Tamil by the GREAT TK Kannaiah Drama Party of TIRUPATTHUR, Tamilnadu, and, 6) the Pravachanams with criticisms on Maha Bharatham, Bhagavatham, and Srimad Ramayanam by late Sri Kadiyala BASAVAYYA NAIDU, late Sri Vallery MUNASWAMY NAIDU, late Sri PATURU RAJAGOPALA NAIDU ,Ex MLA, MLC, and Ex MP on the village rachha-banda
and veedhi arugulu are highly ever memorable, about witch today's children and people don't know and can't understand. My village is very very GREAT in many aspects and I am very proud of them.
Small temple with attractive idol!!
Typical Andhra village Temple
Nice
Our temple

places_with_reviews.name: Swayam Bhvaneshwara Swamy Temple

reviews.text:
Swayambhuvaneswara swamy & Kumara swamy Temple is an old and beautiful temple with historical background located near to the entrance road going to the popular Ardagiri Hanuman temple in Aragonda Village Chittoor district.
One must visit this temple and have dharshan of lord Shiva and Kumara swamy, along with that you can see an old cave entrance inside the temple, which has been closed, but as per the information given by local people, the cave leads to the Ardagiri hill top and has a water canal inside.

Also some tales says that in olden days, rushi's & devatas come to the temple from Ardagiri hill, through this cave in the early morning and perform pooja for lord shiva.

Ardagiri Hanuman temple is yet another popular temple to be visited, which the name Ardagiri means "half of the hill",(i.e part of Sanjeevini hill fell here, while Lord Hanuman carrying it on the way as per the stories) and the Pushkarini near the temple is filled with water since many years has never dried and has medicinal properties and its a cure for many illness.
Nice temple. Very peaceful place. I go to this temple daily. Very peaceful and lovely place.
Nice temple and have a decent sized hall for small to medium-sized functions.....
Nice
Best peaceful place
